Package logger

Class MaiLogger

java.lang.Object
logger.MaiLogger
public class MaiLogger
extends java.lang.Object
The Mailogger class provides the recording of events that occur in a running application It saves these records into log files and sends them to the mainclass If a critical event is logged, the MaiLog.stop() method is called to handle this critical state of the application. This class also provides log-rotation and to set the maximum number of logged information
Version:
2.0
Author:
Neccrocyce
See Also:
Neccrocyce - GitHub, MaiLog, Log

  • Field Details

    • log

      private static java.util.List<Log> log
      A list of all logged events

    • tasks

      private static java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,​Task> tasks
      list of started tasks

    • maxLogs

      private static int maxLogs
      The number of maximum logged events. If maxLogs is -1 this setting is ignored. If there are more logged events, then the oldest one will be deleted until the number of maximum logged events is equals maxLogs.

    • fileName

      private static java.lang.String fileName
      The name of the log file. It is either the name of the class that implements MaiLog or "Log" if MaiLogger hasn't been set up

    • directory

      private static java.lang.String directory
      The directory in which the log files are saved.

    • rotations

      private static int rotations
      The maximum number of files that are created by log rotation.

    • time

      private static boolean time
      Decides whether the time of logging the event is logged, too true: time is logged, false: no time is logged

    • immediateOutput

      private static boolean immediateOutput
      Decides whether tasks will be logged as soon as they start and the status (success/fail/abort) will be logged afterwards or whether tasks will wait until they have been finished or aborted. true: Logging at start, false: Logging when finished.

    • mainClass

      private static MaiLog mainClass
      The class which implements the MaiLog interface

    • activeTask

      private static Task activeTask
      The task which has been started latest and no other event has been logged after that. Otherwise it is null.

  • Constructor Details

    • MaiLogger

      public MaiLogger()

  • Method Details

    • setUp

      public static void setUp​(MaiLog mainClass, int maxLogs, int rotations, boolean time, boolean immediateOutput, java.lang.String directory, java.lang.String logFileName)
      Sets the values which are required to use MaiLogger. Therefore this method needs to be called before using any other method of this class. 
      

      

      Parameters:
      

      mainClass - The class which implements MaiLog interface
      

      maxLogs - The number of maximum logged events
                It is recommended to set it to -1. Otherwise MaiLogger is less efficient, because of creating a new log file every time an event is logged, instead of adding the event to the end of the existing log file.
        -1: infinite (recommended)
        default: -1
      

      rotations - The maximum number of files that are created by log rotation.
        -1: infinite
        default: -1
      

      time - Decides whether the time of each event is logged, too
             default: true
      

      immediateOutput - Decides whether tasks will be logged as soon as they start and the status (success/fail/abort) will be logged afterwards or whether tasks will wait until they have been finished or aborted.
                        default: true
      

      directory - The directory in which the log files are saved
                  default ~/../logs
      

      logFileName - The filename of the logfile
                    default: name of mainClass or "Log" if no setUp is called

 
      

      

      

      • 

    •

int maxLogs,
int rotations,

      setUp
      

      public static void setUp​(int maxLogs,
int rotations,
boolean time,
boolean immediateOutput,
java.lang.String directory,
java.lang.String logFileName)
      

      Sets the values which are required to use MaiLogger. Therefore this method needs to be called before
 using any other method of this class. Use this method if it is not intended to implement the MaiLog interface


 
      

      

      Parameters:
      

      maxLogs - The number of maximum logged events
                It is recommend to set it to -1. Otherwise MaiLogger is less efficient, because of creating a new log file every time an event is logged, instead of adding the event to the end of the existing log file.
        -1: infinite (recommend)
        default: -1
      

      rotations - The maximum number of files that are created by log rotation.
        -1: infinite
        default -1
      

      time - Decides whether the time of each event is logged, too
      

      immediateOutput - Decides whether tasks will be logged as soon as they start and the status (success/fail/abort) will be logged afterwards or whether tasks will wait until they have been finished or aborted.
      

      directory - The directory in which the log files are saved
        default ~/../logs
      

      logFileName - The filename of the logfile
                    default: name of mainClass or "Log" if no setUp is called
 
      

      

      

      • 

    • 

      

      setUp
      

      public static void setUp​(MaiLog mainClass)
      

      Sets the values which are required to use MaiLogger. Therefore this method needs to be called before
 using any other method of this class.
 It sets maxLogs, rotations, time, immediateOutput and directory to default.
      

      

      Parameters:
      

      mainClass - The class which implements MaiLog interface
      

      See Also:
      

      setUp(MaiLog, int, int, boolean, boolean, String, String)

    • 

      

      logNewTask
      

      public static int logNewTask​(java.lang.String msg)
      

      This method logs a new task to the group "TASK" and returns an id representing the task.
 After the task has finished successfully the method @code{succeededTask(int)} should be called with the given id.
 This call will add "SUCCESS" to the corresponding log entry and will switch it to the group "INFO". 
      
 If the task has failed the method @code{failedTask(int)} should be called with the given id.
 This call will add "FAILED" to the corresponding log entry and will switch it to the group "ERROR". 
      
 (e.g: int id = logTask("a task"); succeededTask(id) -> log entry: INFO: a task ... SUCCESS)
      

      

      Parameters:
      

      msg - the description of the event that should be logged
      

      Returns:
      

      the id representing the task
      

      

      

      • 

    • 

      

      succeededTask
      

      public static void succeededTask​(int id)
      

      This method should be called when a task has successfully finished
 It adds "SUCCESS" to the corresponding log entry
      

      

      Parameters:
      

      id - ID representing the task
      

      

      

      • 

    • 

      

      failedTask
      

      public static void failedTask​(int id)
      

      This method should be called when a task has failed
 It adds "FAILED" to the corresponding log entry
      

      

      Parameters:
      

      id - ID representing the task

      Parameters:

      public static void logInfo​(java.lang.String msg)
      

      This method logs an event to the group "INFO". This group logs generally useful information.
      

      

      Parameters:
      

      msg - the description of the event that should be logged

    • 

      

      logWarning
      

      public static void logWarning​(java.lang.String msg)
      

      This method logs an event to the group "WARNING". This group logs events that can potentially lead to a failure.
      

      

      Parameters:
      

      msg - the description of the event that should be logged
      

      

      

      • 

    • 

      

      logError
      

      public static void logError​(java.lang.String msg)
      

      This method logs an event to the group "ERROR". This group logs errors that are fatal to the current operation, but not to the application.
      

      

      Parameters:
      

      msg - the description of the event that should be logged
      

      

      

      • 

    • 

      

      logCritical
      

      public static void logCritical​(java.lang.String msg)
      

      This method logs an event to the group "CRITICAL". This group logs critical errors that is forcing a shutdown of the application.
 Furthermore it calls the MaiLog.stop() method.
      

      

      Parameters:
      

      msg - the description of the event that should be logged
      

      

      

      • 

    • 

      

      logCustom
      

      public static void logCustom​(java.lang.String msg,
java.lang.String group)
      

      This method logs an event to a user-defined group.
      

      

      Parameters:
      

      msg - the description of the event that should be logged
      

      group - The user-defined group

      getLog
      

      @Deprecated
public static java.lang.String getLog​(boolean info,
boolean warning,
boolean error,
boolean critical)
      

      Deprecated.
      

      This method returns the recording of all logged events of every group for which the parameter is set true. It returns in chronologically order
      

      

      Parameters:
      

      info - group INFO (0)
      

      warning - group WARNING (1)
      

      error - group ERROR (2)
      

      critical - group CRITICAL (3)
      

      Returns:
      

      records of all logged events of the requested group(s)
      

      

      

      • 

    • 

      

      getLog
      

      public static java.lang.String getLog​(int... groups)
      

      This method returns the recording of all logged events of every group which is mentioned in groups. It returns in chronologically order
      

      

      Parameters:
      

      groups - An array of groups for which the logs should be returned
      

      Returns:
      

      records of all logged events of the requested group(s)

      Parameters:

      load
      

      public static void load()
                 throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
      

      Loads all logs of the log file (dir/fileName.log) into log
      

      

      Throws:
      

      java.lang.IllegalStateException - if MaiLogger hasn't been set up
      

      

      

      • 

    • 

      

      rotate
      

      public static void rotate()
      

      Rotates the log files and empties log
 "rotate" means:  dir/fileName.log is renamed to dir/fileName.log.1
                                        dir/fileName.log.1 is renamed to dir/fileName.log.2
                                        ...
 if rotations is set and exceed, the oldest file will be deleted
      

      

      • 

    • 

      

      clearLog
      

      public static void clearLog()
      

      empties log
      

      

      • 

    • 

      

      on_exit
      

      public static void on_exit()
      

      This method should be called after the last call to log an entry and before the application will be stopped
 It logs every running task with the suffix "ABORTED BY USER"
 If no tasks have been started, this method hasn't to be called
      

      

      • 

    • 

      

      on_critical
      

      private static void on_critical()
      

      This method is called after a critical event has been logged.
 It logs every running task with the suffix "ABORTED BY CRITICAL STATE"
      

      

      • 

    • 

      

      abortTasks
      

      private static void abortTasks​(java.lang.String msg)
      

      This method logs every running task with the suffix msg
      

      

      Parameters:
      

      msg - reason for the abortion
